verses.text: 亞蘭王的軍長乃縵在他的主人面前是一個大人物，很得王的賞識，因為耶和華曾藉他把勝利賜給亞蘭。這個人是個勇猛的戰士，可惜他是個痲風病人。

words.note: The transliterated Hebrew name of God.
A formal way to say 'give'.

verses.text: 亞蘭人曾經出去結隊搶掠，從以色列地擄了一個小女孩，她就侍候乃縵的妻子。

words.note: Refers to the people of Aram.

words.definition: form a band, go in groups

words.note: More formal than 服務 (fúwù).

verses.text: 她對她的女主人說：「如果我的主人去見撒瑪利亞的先知就好了，他必定能治好他的痲風。」

words.note: Lit. 'first knower'.
Combines 好 (hǎo) 'good' and 了 (le) 'completion/modal particle'.

verses.text: 於是乃縵去告訴他的主人說：「從以色列地擄回來的女孩子這樣這樣說。」

words.note: Repetition implies 'such and such' or 'in this manner'.

verses.text: 亞蘭王說：「你去吧！我會送一封書信給以色列王的。」於是乃縵去了，手裡帶著三百公斤銀子，約七十公斤金子和十套衣裳。

words.note: Both characters individually can mean 'letter'.

words.definition: measure word for sets of clothes

verses.text: 他把信帶到以色列王那裡，信上說：「這信既已達到你那裡，你看見我差去見你的臣僕乃縵，你就要醫好他的痲風。」

words.note: Refers to the content 'on' the letter.
Often combined with '然' as '既然'.
A formal term for a subordinate or servant, common in historical/biblical texts.
Refers to a severe skin disease, often translated as leprosy in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 以色列王讀了這信後，就撕裂自己的衣服，說：「我是 神，能使人死使人活嗎？這人竟派人到我這裡來，要我治好他的痲風。請你們想想看，他是要找機會攻擊我。」

words.note: Used as a time particle following a verb or noun.
Tearing clothes was a sign of distress or mourning in ancient cultures.
Expresses surprise or disbelief.
Reduplication of verb indicates a casual or brief action.

verses.text: 神人以利沙聽見以色列王撕裂自己的衣服，就打發人去見王說：「你為甚麼撕裂自己的衣服呢？請你把他送到我這裡來吧！他就知道在以色列中有先知了。」

words.note: A title of respect for prophets or divine messengers.
打發 is a common verb meaning 'to send' or 'to dispatch'.
Often follows a noun to denote 'among' or 'in the midst of'.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 於是乃縵帶著他的車馬來到，停在以利沙的門前。

words.note: Refers to a retinue of chariots and horses, indicating high status.

verses.text: 以利沙差派一個使者去見他說：「你去在約旦河中沐浴七次，你的身體就會復原，得著潔淨。」

words.note: Often follows a noun to mean 'in' or 'among'.
A more formal and classical term for bathing, often with ritual connotations.
To return to one's original state (of health).
A more formal or literary way of saying '得到'.
Often used in religious contexts for ritual or moral purity.

verses.text: 乃縵卻發怒走了，他說：「我以為他必會出來，站著求告耶和華他的 神的名，向著患處搖手，潔淨這痲風病。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence for God.
Refers to leprosy, a common biblical ailment.

verses.text: 大馬士革的亞罷拿河和法珥法河，不是比以色列一切河流更好嗎？我不是可以在那裡沐浴，得著潔淨嗎？」於是他掉過頭來，氣忿忿地走了。

words.note: Reduplication '忿忿' intensifies the feeling of indignation.

verses.text: 他的僕人上前，對他說：「我父啊，先知如果吩咐你作一件大事，你不是照著行嗎？何況他只是說：『你去沐浴就得潔淨』呢？」
於是他下去，在約旦河裡浸了七趟，正如神人所吩咐的。他的肌肉就復原，好像小孩子的肌肉，他就得了潔淨。
乃縵和他的隨員又回到神人那裡，他進去，站在他面前，說：「看哪！現在我知道除了在以色列以外，全地都沒有 神。現在，請你收下你僕人一點禮物吧。」

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 以利沙說：「我指著我所事奉永活的耶和華起誓，我決不收取任何禮物。」乃縵再三促請他接受，都被他拒絕。

words.note: Contextually, 'swearing by' rather than 'pointing at'.
Indicates passive or object of verb, similar to 'that which'.
Often used for serving God.
Describes God's eternal nature.

verses.text: 乃縵說：「你若是不肯收取，就請你賜你僕人兩頭驢子可以馱的泥土，因為你的僕人不再獻燔祭或別的祭給別的神，只獻給耶和華。

words.note: More formal or archaic, often used for gifts from superiors.
Common in biblical context for 'servant of God' or 'subordinate'.
Measure word for certain animals like donkeys, pigs, cattle.
Can mean 'gods' or 'God' depending on context and capitalization in English.

verses.text: 但有一件事，求耶和華赦免你的僕人；我的主人到臨門廟那裡叩拜的時候，他總是靠在我的手臂上，因此，我也曾在臨門廟叩拜。我在臨門廟叩拜這事，求耶和華赦免你的僕人。」

words.note: Measure word for matters, clothing, or items.
Refers to a deep bow or prostration as an act of reverence or worship.

verses.text: 以利沙說：「你平平安安回去吧。」於是乃縵離開他去了，走了一段路程。

words.note: A common idiom meaning 'peacefully and safely'.
Measure word for sections, periods, or stretches.

verses.text: 神人以利沙的僕人基哈西心裡說：「看哪，我主人不肯從這亞蘭人乃縵手中收取他帶來的禮物；我指著永活的耶和華起誓，我要追上他，向他要些東西。」

words.note: An interjection used to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
Contextually, 'swearing by' rather than 'pointing at'.
Common word for 'things'; its literal 'east-west' etymology is rarely thought of in modern use.

verses.text: 於是基哈西追趕乃縵。乃縵看見有人追上來，就下車迎著他，說：「平安嗎？」

words.note: Common greeting in biblical context, asking about one's well-being.

verses.text: 他說：「平安。我主人派我來說：『剛才有兩位年輕人，都是先知的門徒，從以法蓮山地來到我這裡，請你給他們三十公斤銀子和兩套衣服。』」

words.note: Here used as an affirmative reply, meaning 'yes, all is well'.
Polite measure word for people.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Often refers to silver currency in biblical contexts.
Used for sets of things, like clothes or furniture.

verses.text: 乃縵說：「請你拿六十公斤吧。」他再三促請基哈西，並把六十公斤銀子，裝在兩個袋子裡，還有兩套衣服，交給兩個僕人。他們就在基哈西前面捧著走。

words.note: Indicates a suggestion, request, or mild command.
Introduces the object of a verb, indicating disposal or handling.

verses.text: 到達山岡後，他就從他們手中接過東西，存放在屋子裡，然後打發他們離去，他們就走了。

words.note: Lit. 'east-west', a common term for objects.
Indicates completion of an action or a change of state.

verses.text: 他進去，侍立在他主人面前，以利沙對他說：「基哈西，你從哪裡來？」他說：「你的僕人沒有到過甚麼地方。」

words.note: The '過' indicates a past experience.

verses.text: 以利沙對他說：「那人下車轉身迎著你的時候，我的心不是和你同去嗎？現在不是收受銀子、衣服、橄欖園、葡萄園、羊、牛、僕人和婢女的時候。

words.note: Refers to getting out of a vehicle, in biblical context, often a chariot.
Often used in contexts of illicit or inappropriate receiving.
Refers to a male servant, often a bondservant in biblical contexts.
Refers to a female servant, often a bondservant in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 因此，乃縵的痲風要附在你的身上和你後裔的身上，直到永遠。」基哈西從以利沙面前離去時，就長了痲風，好像雪那樣白。

words.note: Refers to leprosy, a serious skin disease in biblical times.
Here 長 (zhǎng) means 'to grow/develop', not 'long' (cháng).
Refers to leprosy, a serious skin disease in biblical times.
